content.detail: Study ID is empty
content.solution: Fill in a study ID

content.detail: Study title not given
content.solution: Fill in study title

content.detail: Missing InfoSheet.
Unknown headers
content.solution: Check headers

content.detail: SSDGenerator: no studyUri provided for SOC generator with typeUri [%s]
SSDGenerator: no SOCReference provided for SOC generator
VirtualColumnGenerator: no studyUri provided for generator with typeUri [%s]
VirtualColumnGenerator: no SOCReference provided for generator
SSD ingestion: Could not find the study uri <%s> in the TS, check the study uri in the SSD sheet.
SSD ingestion: There is no SOC of type hasco:SubjectGroup, make sure one and only one SOC is of type hasco:SubjectGroup.
SSD ingestion: There is more than one SOC of type hasco:SubjectGroup, make sure one and only one SOC is of type hasco:SubjectGroup.
The Info sheet is missing in this SDD file.
SSDGenerator: no SOCReference provided for SOC generator
This SDD has no SDD_ID filled.
content.solution: In the Info sheet of the SDD, fill in the value for SDD_ID

content.detail: Read Data Dictionary failed, please refer to the error msg above.
The Codebook of this SDD is either invalid or empty.
The TimeLine of this SDD is empty.
The Dictionary Mapping has is EMPTY.
Attribute %s is not attributeOf any object. Please fix the content.
The Entity Cell "%s" in the [Entity] column is either not valid uri or it can not be resolved by replaceNameSpaceEx().
"%s" at column [attributeOf] , row [%s] contains illegal content.
The Dictionary Mapping contains illegal content in "%s" in the [Column] column. Check if it contains characters such as "," and blank space.
The Dictionary Mapping has unregistered namespace in the following cells: %s .
The Dictionary Mapping has the following cells with missing labels: %s .
The Attributes: [%s] are subclasses of neither hasco:StudyIndicator nor hasco:SampleIndicator .
The Dictionary Mapping has incorrect content in : %s in "attributeOf" column .
The CodeMapping of this SDD is empty .
Failed to download the CodeMapping of this SDD .
This SDD has no Version filled.
content.solution: In the Info sheet of the SDD, fill in the value for Version

content.detail: The Info sheet is missing in this SDD file.
content.solution: Make sure the STR spreadsheet includes a sheet called InfoSheet. The InfoSheet for STR needs to have all the fields listed in the STR specification. See User Guide.

content.detail: The study id [%s] specified in the STR InfoSheet is not of a valid study.
content.solution: Fix the value under Study_Id in the InfoSheet. Go to Manage Studies to see a list of valid studies.

content.detail: The STR file needs to be in Excel (*.xlsx) format.
content.solution: If the STR file is in a format like *.csv, it must be loaded into Excel and saved using the *.xlsx format.

content.detail: The FileStream sheet is missing.
content.solution: The FileStream sheet is required even if the sheet is empty. Add a FileStream sheet to the STR

content.detail: The MessageStream sheet is missing.
content.solution: The MessageStream sheet is required even if the sheet is empty. Add a MessageStream sheet to the STR

content.detail: The STR file cannot have both the FileStream sheet and the MessageStream sheet empty.
content.solution: Fill out the FileStream sheet or the MessageStream sheet

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, the data dictionary ID <%s> is not of a valid SDD.
content.solution: Fix the 'data dict' field with the ID of a valid SDD

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, could not find triples about specified object collections, SSD is probably incorrectly ingested.
content.solution: Delete and reingest the associated SSD

content.detail: MESSAGESTREAM sheet and MESSAGETOPIC sheet need both to be empty or to be filled out completely.
content.solution: Either add content to both sheets or completely remove their content.

content.detail: In MESSAGESTREAM sheet, the hasURI field cannot be empty or null.
content.solution: Assign an URI value to the hasURI field

content.detail: In MESSAGESTREAM sheet, the data dictionary ID cannot be empty or null.
content.solution: Assign an ID to the 'data dict' field

content.detail: In MESSAGESTREAM sheet, the data dictionary ID <%s> is not of a valid SDD.
content.solution: Fix the 'data dict' field with the ID of a valid SDD

content.detail: In MESSAGESTREAM, deployment [%s] could not be found. Check if DPL was ingested and is correct
content.solution: Check if the missing deployment is specified in a DPL file.

content.detail: In MESSAGESTREAM, study object with URI [%s], which is specified in a cell scope, could not be found. Checke if SSD was ingested and is correct.
content.solution: Check if the SSD for the study has been load. If the SSD was loaded, check if the study object is specified in the SSD.

content.detail: The MESSAGETOPIC sheet is missing.
content.solution: The MessageTopic sheet is required even if the sheet is empty. Add a MessageTopic sheet to the STR

content.detail: In MESSAGESTREAM sheet, the protocol value cannot be empty or null.
content.solution: Assign a value to the protocol field

content.detail: In MESSAGESTREAM sheet, the IP value cannot be empty or null.
content.solution: Assign a value to the IP field

content.detail: In MESSAGESTREAM sheet, the stream's name cannot be empty or null.
content.solution: Assign a value to the stream's name

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, the stream's 'DA NAME' cannot be empty or null.
content.solution: Assign a value to the stream's 'DA NAME'

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, the stream's data dictionary cannot be empty or null.
content.solution: Assign a value to the stream's data dictionary

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, the stream's deployment cannot be empty or null.
content.solution: Assign a value to the stream's deployment

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, CellScope ill-formed: should start with '<'.
content.solution: Start the cellscope (the entire value of cell scope) with '<'

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, CellScope ill-formed: should end with >.
content.solution: End the cellscope (the entire value of cell scope) with '>'

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, CellScope ill-formed: cell spec <%s> should start with '<'
content.solution: Start the identified cell spec with '<'

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, CellScope ill-formed: cell spec <%s> should end with '>'
content.solution: End the identified cell spec with a '>'

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, CellScope ill-formed: cell spec <%s> should have a name and an URI
content.solution: A cell spec should have a pair of values

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, the specified owner email <%s> is not a valid user
content.solution: Provide a valid owner email

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, owner email is missing
content.solution: Provide the email of a valid user as owner email

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, Owner Email is not specified for Row <%s>
content.solution: For the given row, provide the email of a valid user as owner email

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, could not retrieve user with owner email <%s>
content.solution: For the given row, provide the email of a valid user as owner email

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, permission URI is not specified for Row <%s>
content.solution: For the given row, provide a valid permission URI for identified row

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, no platform is specified for deployment <%s>
content.solution: In DPL file, verify if a platform is specified for the identified deployment

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, no instrument is specified for deployment <%s>
content.solution: In DPL file, verify if an instrument is specified for the identified deoployment

content.detail: In FILESTREAM sheet, SDD <%s> cannot be retrieved.
content.solution: For the identified SDD, make sure the SDD file is properly ingested.

content.detail: MeasurementGeneration: failed to initialize the data ingestion.
SSDGenerator: no SOCReference provided for SOC generator
STR for the uri <%s> is incomplete
Cannot find STR with following URI: <%s>
Cannot load SDD specified for the following STR: <%s>
Cannot load deployment specified for the following STR: <%s>
SDD <%s> cannot be found
content.solution: Make sure the identified SDD has been ingested prior to the ingestion of this DA file

content.detail: Study is missing for the following STR: <%s>
content.solution: Add a valid study id to the STR for of this file stream

content.detail: Missing InfoSheet.
content.solution: Use Excel to open this file and see if it has a sheet called 'InfoSheet'. If not, create such sheet.

content.detail: Missing Study_ID property in InfoSheet.
content.solution: Include a valid Study_ID property into InfoSheet.

content.detail: Study_ID property <%s> in InfoSheet is invalid.
content.solution: Study_ID property in InfoSheet is not of a valid study. Replace the property with a valid study id.

content.detail: Invalid/missing Version property in InfoSheet.
content.solution: Correct/include a valid Version property into InfoSheet.

content.detail: Missing Filenames Sheet.
content.solution: Include a 'Filenames' sheet into the DOI file.

content.detail: Error processing DOI Generator.
Failed to retrieve DA <%s>
content.solution: DA file was not ingested prior the execution of this DOI file.

content.detail: Unsupported file name prefix, acceptable prefixes are DA-, DOI-, DPL-, STR-, SDD-, SSD-, STD-
content.solution: Rename the current file to have a valid prefix. Please note that the prefixes end with an hyphen, not an underscore

content.detail: Already processed a file with the same name %s .
content.solution: Either remove this file or the old file before moving forward.

content.detail: Unknown file format: %s
content.solution: Known formats are .csv or .xlsx
